alert.note: Alert for Hickman; Houston; Humphreys; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 8:53PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dickson, southwestern Montgomery, southeastern Stewart, Houston, southwestern Cheatham, Humphreys and northwestern Hickman Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 853 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles east of Erin to near Waverly. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dickson, Waverly, Camden, Erin, White Bluff, McEwen, Burns, Tennessee Ridge, Hurricane Mills, Charlotte, Vanleer, Cumberland City, Slayden, Cheatham Dam, Palmyra, Bucksnort, Pinewood and Cunningham. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 145 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
